prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three deeks:
1. Dalmatian
2. mutt
3. terrier

Now pick out the other deeks from the following list:
1. bear
2. chiller truck
3. yellow bell pepper
4. full-trailer truck
5. basset hound
6. seal
7. carrot
8. car
9. onion
10. crane
11. pumpkin
12. red bell pepper
13. school bus
14. bee
15. Dalmatian
16. Labrador
17. cat
18. eggplant
19. loader
20. box truck
21. green bell pepper


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. tractor and red bell pepper
2. potato and carrot
3. green bell pepper and school bus
4. green bell pepper and cat
5. box truck and garbage truck
6. yellow bell pepper and toucan
7. onion and toucan
8. potato and cat
9. motorcycle and Labrador
10. Dalmatian and loader
11. crane and basset hound
12. crane and yellow bell pepper
13. garbage truck and pumpkin
14. potato and school bus
15. green bell pepper and carrot
16. mutt and yellow bell pepper
17. tractor and basset hound
18. motorcycle and garbage truck
19. full-trailer truck and eggplant
20. garbage truck and full-trailer truck
21. garbage truck and mutt
22. Dalmatian and toucan
23. mutt and carrot
24. red bell pepper and car
25. crane and onion
26. yellow bell pepper and chiller truck
27. garbage truck and yellow bell pepper
28. bee and loader
29. yellow bell pepper and Labrador
30. tractor and garbage truck
31. seal and potato
32. yellow bell pepper and semi-trailer truck
33. garbage truck and eggplant
34. mutt and bear
35. pig and cat
36. bee and toucan
37. bee and onion
38. semi-trailer truck and eggplant
39. garbage truck and toucan
40. motorcycle and onion
41. crane and terrier
42. tractor and Labrador
43. mutt and loader
44. green bell pepper and terrier
45. red bell pepper and toucan
46. semi-trailer truck and onion
47. green bell pepper and chiller truck
48. garbage truck and carrot
49. box truck and bear
50. semi-trailer truck and pumpkin


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.
